intro: Euphrasia stricta var. curta, commonly known as the short-stemmed eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It is known for its medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies for eye conditions. Its flowering period is brief, making it a rare and delicate sight in its natural environment.
